context: Comprehensive prompt engineering optimization with 75+ empirical benchmarks
reproducible_prompt: PROMPT help me go through 5 cycles of prompt engineering based on the tests, save the different prompts and compare which one is the best

technique_1_supremacy.finding: Be Clear and Direct (Technique #1) beats all other techniques
technique_1_supremacy.evidence: V4 (explicit rules only): 3.84s, 100% vs V2 (XML + examples): 3.96s, 100%

three_example_sweet_spot.finding: 3 examples optimal, 5 examples no better but slower
three_example_sweet_spot.impact: Stop at 3 examples when quality at ceiling

minimal_catastrophe.evidence: V2d (70 tokens): 31s avg, 47s worst | V5 (15 tokens): 186s spike | Normal: 3-4s

over_optimization_backfire.finding: All optimization iterations slower than original
over_optimization_backfire.evidence: V2: 3.96s | V2a: 4.06s | V2c: 4.06s | V2b: 4.46s + quality drop
over_optimization_backfire.impact: Test each change, stop at quality plateau

redundancy_helps.finding: Stating constraints multiple ways improves compliance
redundancy_helps.evidence: V4 stated 'no markdown' 3 ways â†’ 100% compliance

xml_overhead.impact: Use XML when clarity justifies 10% cost

winner.technique: Be Clear and Direct with redundant constraints

final_optimization.changes: Removed redundancy, tightened prose, maximized scannability while keeping all Anthropic-authoritative content
